thread.title: Towns explodes for 37 points as Wolves crush Nets | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Towns explodes for 37 points as Wolves crush Nets | NBA | Sporting News

author: Nba Australia
title: Towns explodes for 37 points as Wolves crush Nets | NBA | Sporting News
text:
January 29, 2017 1:24am EST January 29, 2017 1:04am EST Wolves make it seven wins from their past 10 games. NBA Australia 
Published on Jan. 29, 2017 
Jan. 29, 2017 
Karl-Anthony Towns' 37 points and 13 rebounds led the Minnesota Timberwolves to a 129-109 win over the Brooklyn Nets. 
MORE: NBA investigating potential impact U.S. travel order has on league 
The win marked the Wolves' seventh game form their past 10 as they continue to surge towards the eighth seed in the West. 
Andrew Wiggins added 23 points and four assists, while Zach LaVine chipped in 20 points on the night. 
Nets' big man Brook Lopez put up a fight against Towns with Lopez finishing with 25 points and seven rebounds of his own, but the Wolves' young star was relentless on offence. 
In the third quarter, Brooklyn cut the Wolves' lead from 16 to five, when Towns then scored six straight points to open up a 10-0 run which put the Wolves up 89-74. 
“There’s so much he can do and he’s such a threat pretty much anywhere on the court,” Lopez said post-game. 
“It makes it tough. You have to be aggressive with him and try to make his catches and looks as difficult as possible.” 
Minnesota now prepares to take on the Orlando Magic at home on Tuesday AEDT.
